revised_title: Improvements in Telescope Mountings at Birr Castle Observatory
tldr: The Earl of Rosse describes recent improvements made to the mountings of telescopes at Birr Castle Observatory, focusing on the six-foot reflector and the three-foot reflector. The author discusses the implementation of a clock-movement for the six-foot reflector's motion and the development of a new equatorial mounting for the three-foot reflector, which aimed to provide greater steadiness and ease of motion. These improvements allowed for more efficient and accurate astronomical observations.
